header.title: Esoteric Extension of Tarot to Develop Supersensory Powers

central_thesis: This lesson explores how the principles embodied in Tarot Key #4, The Emperor, can be utilized to develop supersensory powers by enhancing perceptive abilities, cultivating accurate reasoning, and achieving self-rulership, ultimately leading to a deeper understanding of oneself and others, and a more effective interaction with reality.

structure_content.chapter_title: Lesson 19: Esoteric Extension of Tarot to Develop Supersensory Powers
structure_content.summary: The lesson introduces the concept of developing supersensory powers, primarily focusing on enhanced perception and understanding of others. It posits that physical sight is limited and introduces Tarot Key #4, The Emperor, as a tool to develop a deeper way of 'seeing' people. This involves moving beyond surface-level judgments, recognizing the underlying struggles and insecurities in individuals, and cultivating one's own inner strength and perception. The text emphasizes the importance of accurate reasoning, self-awareness, and the ability to see through personal and societal 'masks' or 'facades'. It highlights that true perception leads to greater empathy and understanding, enabling one to assist others. The lesson also touches upon the spiritual significance of colors, contrasting the common occult view of pastels as spiritual with the assertion that vivid colors, particularly red associated with The Emperor, signify spiritual force and rulership. The ultimate goal is to achieve self-rulership and extend this awareness to all of life, facilitated by the symbolic power of the Tarot cards, particularly The Emperor and Empress, as channels for higher intelligences. A specific technique for working with The Emperor is provided.

key_concepts.definition: Looking is superficial physical observation, while 'seeing' implies a deeper, intuitive, and analytical perception that penetrates beyond surface appearances to understand the inner nature, motivations, and personalities of individuals and situations. This is cultivated through focused attention and the application of Tarot principles.

Symbolizes the power of vision, accurate reasoning, self-rulership, and the ability to govern one's inner and outer environment. It represents the masculine aspect of the Godhead, embodying force, action, and logical interpretation, and serves as a key to understanding personality and developing psychic abilities.

The ability to interpret oneself and the world, essential for accurate judgment and problem-solving. It involves the capacity to see, remember, and imagine, particularly the ability to place oneself in another's position to understand their conduct. This faculty is considered fundamental to shaping one's reality and future.

The primary objective of developing supersensory powers is to gain dominion over one's own thoughts, emotions, and circumstances. This inner control is a prerequisite for effective interaction with the external world and is a manifestation of the Higher Self or God within.

The lesson distinguishes between the 'struggling infant' of personality, with its inherent weaknesses and undeveloped aspects, and the divine 'God Level' or 'Higher Self' within each individual. True perception involves recognizing and honoring the Higher Self, even within the struggles of personality.

People often hide their true selves behind artificial presentations or 'masks' to be perceived in a certain light. Developing deeper perception allows one to see through these facades and understand the underlying reality of individuals.

Insecurity is identified as a root cause for individuals who disparage others as an immature coping mechanism. Recognizing this allows for a more constructive and less reactive approach to such behavior.

Contrasting with some occult traditions that equate pastel colors with spirituality, this lesson asserts that vivid colors, particularly the brilliant scarlet red associated with The Emperor, signify spiritual force, vitality, and power. Vividness in awareness and feeling is presented as a part of spiritual growth.

practical_system.description: The system described focuses on developing supersensory powers, specifically enhanced perception and accurate reasoning, by applying the principles of Tarot Key #4, The Emperor. This involves a conscious effort to look beyond surface appearances, understand the underlying motivations and insecurities of oneself and others, and cultivate a strong inner rulership of thoughts and emotions. The practice encourages a continuous, almost meditative, observation of the world and its inhabitants, viewing all through the symbolic lens of The Emperor as a symbol of reasoned authority and divine perception. The ultimate aim is self-mastery and a heightened awareness that allows for more effective navigation of life's challenges and a deeper connection to one's Higher Self.
tools: The concept of the Higher Self/God Level
The reasoning faculty itself, honed through practice
rituals: Immersing oneself in the color scarlet red.
Visualizing Tarot Key #4 (The Emperor) in full life size and three dimensions, focusing on its symbols (cube, armor, staff of dominion).
Meditating on the Emperor as a symbol of rulership of the reasoning faculty and a connection to the Cosmic Father.
Practicing continuous, detailed observation of nature, animals, and people, consciously invoking the idea 'God sees this through my eyes'.

Affirmation: 'I am child of my Heavenly Father. I inherit my gift of vision, both inner and outer, from Him. I am a prince (or princess) learning how to gain dominion over the plot of land my Father has given me, my environment. As I learn, my vision expands into more and more accurate interpretation and reasoning ability. This gives me the power to control and rule circumstances ever more effectively. I thank thee, O physical father, for having been the channel in and through which my Cosmic Father has given me of his Spiritual Seed. Before I was blind, but now I see. I acknowledge myself as child of Deity. How much bluer the sky, how much brighter the hues of life around me as I expand my vision into the Infinite.'
Cultivating a heightened perception by learning to 'be in love all of the time with life and with God'.

relevant_quotes.text: First of all, we must recognize that what the physical eye sees is only a partial picture. Therefore, we need to develop the habit of looking at people with the power of Tarot Key #4, The Emperor, in the background of our minds!
By developing our own deep perceptions, we tend to fill our own empty spaces and substitute strengths for weaknesses.

When we meet people, we want them to think we are intelligent and attractive; there is nothing wrong with this. The point is that if we wish to develop perceptiveness, we must watch our own posturing, too.

When we see into hearts, we decide that all hearts are much the same. Everyone is somewhat lonely; everyone wants to be loved, whether he admits it or not. Everyone yearns to be understood, whether he is given to understanding or not. Everyone feels insecure, whether he is willing to give other people security or not.

Some people, we will discover, are so shy they seem willing to do nothing to receive attention, understanding or love. If you become aware of their shyness, you will cease to think of them as arrogant. Most of the people whom we think arrogant are really only shy.
If you find that some people have a need to disparage others, what could be the reason but insecurity?
You cannot learn to be objective about people if you hold strongly preconceived ideas of what it is to be good or bad. You must be willing to shift your views, to reason things out.
You are the one who always rules your world, whether you realize it or not.
The red of Key 4, The Emperor, symbolizes action, the force of Mars, the drive of rulership.
Be careful not to confuse this with the power complex. The difference is the concept that God is the power ruling through personality, as the Emperor depicts.

The Emperor is a symbol of your power of vision, your power to perceive thought and emotion more readily than you have in the past. Give your problems to that Ruler within for more acute reasoning, for more accurate interpretation.
Do not think that pain is an inevitable and permanent part of life. It is not. The ability to be willing to see the real, rather than wear blinders, will free you from it.
Lift your heart to that Ruler, the real interpreter of life, He who truly sees. Let the Emperor truly see through your personality.

The art of true seeing should be performed almost continuously. Try to keep a memory of its working within you. Develop within yourself a constructive compulsion, so that whenever you look at a tree, you say to yourself, "God sees this tree through my eyes."

The lover looks at the world with a heightened perception because his consciousness is heightened. The consciousness is actually heightened when one is in love. We have to learn how to be in love all of the time with life and with God.
Reason is the shield that protects us from becoming caught up in destructive forces.

critical_analysis.relevance: This text offers a practical esoteric framework for developing enhanced perception and psychological insight, presented through the lens of Tarot symbolism. It is relevant to practitioners interested in moving beyond superficial understanding of self and others, aiming for a more conscious and controlled interaction with reality. The emphasis on the Emperor as a symbol of reasoned rulership and perception aligns with hermetic and magical traditions that seek to master the self and one's environment. The critique of common occult color symbolism also provides an interesting point of comparison within esoteric discourse.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience includes students of Western Esotericism, Tarot enthusiasts, practitioners of psychic development, and individuals interested in self-mastery and developing deeper interpersonal perception. It assumes a certain familiarity with esoteric concepts and a willingness to engage in contemplative and self-observational practices.
